## Overview

Keyboard shortcuts dramatically speed up your workflow in ozen-web. This page lists all available shortcuts organized by category.

::: {.callout-tip}
**Tip:** Print this page or keep it open in a second tab while learning ozen-web.
:::

## Audio Playback

| Key | Action | Notes |
|-----|--------|-------|
| <kbd>Space</kbd> | Play/pause selection | If no selection, plays from cursor to end of visible window |
| <kbd>Tab</kbd> | Play visible window | Plays entire time range currently shown |
| <kbd>Escape</kbd> | Stop playback & clear selection | Stops audio and removes selection highlight |

## Navigation

| Key | Action | Notes |
|-----|--------|-------|
| <kbd>←</kbd> <kbd>→</kbd> | Move cursor | Left/Right arrows move cursor by ~10ms increments |
| <kbd>Shift</kbd>+<kbd>←</kbd> <kbd>→</kbd> | Extend/shrink selection | Adjust selection boundaries |
| <kbd>Mouse Wheel</kbd> | Zoom in/out | Centered on mouse cursor position |
| <kbd>+</kbd> / <kbd>-</kbd> | Zoom in/out | Centered on time cursor position |
| <kbd>Horizontal Scroll</kbd> | Pan view | Two-finger swipe on trackpads |
| <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>Drag</kbd> | Pan view | Alternative to scrollbar |

## Editing (Annotations & Data Points)

| Key | Action | Notes |
|-----|--------|-------|
| <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>Z</kbd> | Undo | Mac: <kbd>Cmd</kbd>+<kbd>Z</kbd> |
| <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>Y</kbd> | Redo | Mac: <kbd>Cmd</kbd>+<kbd>Shift</kbd>+<kbd>Z</kbd> |
| <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>Shift</kbd>+<kbd>Z</kbd> | Redo (alternative) | Cross-platform consistency |
| <kbd>Enter</kbd> | Save edited label | When editing interval text |
| <kbd>Escape</kbd> | Cancel label edit | Discards changes to interval label |
| <kbd>Delete</kbd> | Remove selected item | Works on selected boundary or data point (if implemented) |

## Annotation Tiers

| Key | Action | Notes |
|-----|--------|-------|
| <kbd>1</kbd> | Select tier 1 | Makes tier 1 active for editing |
| <kbd>2</kbd> | Select tier 2 | Makes tier 2 active for editing |
| <kbd>3</kbd> | Select tier 3 | Makes tier 3 active for editing |
| <kbd>4</kbd> | Select tier 4 | Makes tier 4 active for editing |
| <kbd>5</kbd> | Select tier 5 | Makes tier 5 active for editing |
| <kbd>Double-click</kbd> on tier | Add boundary | At cursor time position |
| <kbd>Double-click</kbd> on interval | Edit label | Opens text input for interval |
| <kbd>Right-click</kbd> on boundary | Remove boundary menu | Shows context menu |
| <kbd>Drag</kbd> boundary | Move boundary | Adjust boundary time position |

## Data Points

| Key | Action | Notes |
|-----|--------|-------|
| <kbd>Double-click</kbd> on spectrogram | Add data point | At clicked time/frequency |
| <kbd>Drag</kbd> data point | Move data point | Adjust time and/or frequency position |
| <kbd>Right-click</kbd> on data point | Remove data point | Shows context menu |
| <kbd>Click</kbd> data point | Select & view values | Values panel updates |

## Mouse & Click Actions

| Action | Result | Location |
|--------|--------|----------|
| **Single Click** | Place cursor | Waveform or spectrogram |
| **Click & Drag** | Select time region | Waveform or spectrogram |
| **Double-click** | Add boundary | Annotation tier |
| **Double-click** | Edit interval label | Annotation interval |
| **Double-click** | Add data point | Spectrogram (outside tiers) |
| **Right-click** | Context menu | Boundary or data point |
| **Drag** | Move boundary/point | Boundary line or data point |
| **Scroll Wheel** | Zoom | Waveform or spectrogram |

## Platform-Specific Shortcuts

### Windows/Linux

| Key | Mac Equivalent |
|-----|----------------|
| <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> | <kbd>Cmd</kbd> |
| <kbd>Alt</kbd> | <kbd>Option</kbd> |

### macOS

Most shortcuts use <kbd>Cmd</kbd> instead of <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>:

- **Undo:** <kbd>Cmd</kbd>+<kbd>Z</kbd>
- **Redo:** <kbd>Cmd</kbd>+<kbd>Shift</kbd>+<kbd>Z</kbd>
- **Pan:** <kbd>Cmd</kbd>+<kbd>Drag</kbd>

## Tips for Efficient Workflow

::: {.callout-tip}
**Master these shortcuts first:**

1. <kbd>Space</kbd> — Play selection (most used)
2. <kbd>Scroll Wheel</kbd> — Zoom (essential for navigation)
3. <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>Z</kbd> — Undo (safety net)
4. <kbd>Double-click</kbd> — Add boundaries and data points
5. <kbd>1-5</kbd> — Switch between annotation tiers
:::

### Typical Annotation Workflow

1. <kbd>Scroll Wheel</kbd> — Zoom to see target region
2. <kbd>Click</kbd> — Place cursor at boundary location
3. <kbd>Space</kbd> — Play selection to verify
4. <kbd>Double-click tier</kbd> — Add boundary
5. <kbd>Double-click interval</kbd> — Edit label
6. <kbd>Enter</kbd> — Save label
7. <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>Z</kbd> — Undo if needed

### Typical Data Collection Workflow

1. <kbd>Scroll Wheel</kbd> — Zoom to vowel
2. <kbd>Click</kbd> — Place cursor at vowel midpoint
3. <kbd>Space</kbd> — Play to verify location
4. <kbd>Double-click spectrogram</kbd> — Add data point
5. Check values panel for measurements
6. Repeat for all target segments

## Customization

Currently, keyboard shortcuts are not customizable. This may change in future versions.

If you need different key bindings, please [open an issue](https://github.com/ucpresearch/ozen-web/issues) on GitHub.

## Accessibility

ozen-web aims to be keyboard-accessible for users who cannot use a mouse:

- All major functions have keyboard shortcuts
- Tab navigation works for UI controls
- Screen reader support is limited (this is an area for improvement)

**Suggestions for accessibility improvements are welcome!** Please [contribute feedback](https://github.com/ucpresearch/ozen-web/discussions).

## Browser-Specific Notes

### Chrome/Edge

- All shortcuts work as expected
- Best overall experience

### Firefox

- All shortcuts work
- Slightly different scroll behavior on some platforms

### Safari

- All shortcuts work
- <kbd>Cmd</kbd> key on macOS instead of <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>

## Mobile/Touch

The mobile viewer (`/viewer` route) uses touch gestures instead of keyboard shortcuts:

- **Tap** → Place cursor
- **Drag** → Select region
- **Two-finger drag** → Pan
- **Pinch** → Zoom

**See:** [Mobile Viewer Documentation](../features/mobile-viewer.html)
